Name: The Amalfi
Ingredients: 60 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: DRY SHAKE (without ice) all ingredients. Add ice, SHAKE again and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: A flavour reminiscent of lemon meringue charged with light rum and enhanced with a dash of maraschino.
History: Adapted from a drink created in 2010 by Andy Pearson, London, England for Barack Obama.
Nutrition: One serving of The Amalfi contains 187 calories
